required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Behavioural and Electrophysiological Effects of rTMS in Functional Neurological Disorders
clinical_study.official_title: Assessing the Behavioural and Electrophysiological Effects of Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation on "Intention" vs "Overt Action" in Patients With Functional Neurological Disorders

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to better understand Functional Neurological Disorders (FND) by measuring movement timing and brain activity in patients with FND during deliberate movements and when expressing an 'intention' to move. This investigation will use non-invasive brain stimulation to investigate the role of the temporal-occipital-parietal junction in FND.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study seeks to improve our neurophysiological understanding of Functional Neurological Disorders (FND) by measuring movement timing and brain activity while individuals with FND perform a simple pointing task.
Behavioural (timing of arm and finger movement) and electrophysiological (electroencephalography; EEG) measures will be collected both at rest and while participants perform a voluntary movement task designed to discriminate between brain events related to intention vs. overt action.
Furthermore, this study will investigate the ability of a non-invasive brain stimulation technique called repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS) to alter brain activity in the temporal-occipital-parietal junction (TPJ), a region known to be hypo-active in individuals with FND. Tasks and cortical recordings will be repeated following rTMS to determine the effect of brain stimulation on behaviour and brain activity.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in relative timing of intention-to-act vs action production
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 hour: Immediately prior to and following one session of rTMS
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of change in the lag time between intended and actual action production during pointing and stimulus response tasks.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in resting state activity in temporal-parietal junction brain region
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 hour: Immediately prior to and following one session of rTMS
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of changes in EEG brain activity readings when participants are at rest at various frequencies, primarily targeting delta/theta bands.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in brain activity related to 'intention to act'
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 hour: Immediately prior to and following one session of rTMS
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of changes in ERP waveform amplitude related to the 'intention to act' time-stamp during the movement task.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in brain activity related to motor production
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 hour: Immediately prior to and following one session of rTMS
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of changes in ERP waveform amplitude related to the 'motor production' time-stamp during the movement task.

arm_group.description: 1 session (3,000 pulses) of high-frequency (10Hz) repetitive stimulation applied over the right temporal parietal junction (TPJ) gyrus in individuals with Functional Neurological Disorder using a MagStim Rapid2 Transcranial Magnetic Simulation machine.

intervention.description: A non-invasive method of brain stimulation
